question:
With respect to the recent developments in the impeachment proceeding of the US President, consider the following statements:
  1. The Senate has the sole power of impeachment while the House of Representatives have the sole power of trying all impeachments.
  2. Impeachment managers will argue the case against the president.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The power to impeach the president lies solely with the House of Representatives- which is the lower house of the parliament. The power to try all impeachments lies solely with the US Senate- which is the upper house of the parliament. Â Statement 2 is correct: The impeachment managers are prosecutors chosen by the US house speaker. They are to argue the case against the president during the impeachment trails in the Senate. The US speaker has chosen 7 impeachment managers for this job. Their performance in crucial in determining the outcome of the trial.
